description.text: The close event is fired on IDBDatabase when the database connection is unexpectedly closed. This could happen, for example, if the underlying storage is removed or if the user clears the database in the browser's history preferences.

description.html: The close event is sent to the onclose event handler on an RTCDataChannel instance when the data transport for the data channel has closed. Before any further data can be transferred using RTCDataChannel, a new 'RTCDataChannel' instance must be created.

description.html: The close event is fired when a connection with a WebSocket is closed.
description.text: The close event is fired when a connection with a WebSocket is closed.

description.html: The DOM beforeinput event fires when the value of an <input>, or <textarea> element is about to be modified. The event also applies to elements with contenteditable enabled, and to any element when designMode is turned on.
description.text: The DOM beforeinput event fires when the value of an <input>, or <textarea> element is about to be modified. The event also applies to elements with contenteditable enabled, and to any element when designMode is turned on.

description.html: The input event fires when the value of an <input>, <select>, or <textarea> element has been changed.

description.html: The formdata event fires after the entry list representing the form's data is constructed. This happens when the form is submitted, but can also be triggered by the invocation of a FormData() constructor.

description.html: The reset event fires when a <form> is reset.

description.html: The reset event is sent to an XRReferenceSpace object when a discontinuity is detected in either the native origin or the effective origin, causing a jump in the position or orientation of objects oriented using the reference space. This is common when the user calibrates or recalibrates an XR device, or if the device automatically changes its origin after losing tracking of the user, then re-gaining it.

description.html: The submit event fires when a <form> is submitted.

description.html: The invalid event fires when a submittable element has been checked for validity and doesn't satisfy its constraints.

description.html: The canplaythrough event is fired when the user agent can play the media, and estimates that enough data has been loaded to play the media up to its end without having to stop for further buffering of content.

description.html: The emptied event is fired when the media has become empty; for example, this event is sent if the media has already been loaded (or partially loaded), and the load() method is called to reload it.

description.html: The playing event is fired after playback is first started, and whenever it is restarted. For example it is fired when playback resumes after having been paused or delayed due to lack of data.

description.html: The stalled event is fired when the user agent is trying to fetch media data, but data is unexpectedly not forthcoming.

description.html: The suspend event is fired when media data loading has been suspended.

description.html: The timeupdate event is fired when the time indicated by the currentTime attribute has been updated.

description.html: The volumechange event is fired when the volume has changed.

description.html: A statechange event occurs when the RTCIceTransport changes state. The state can be used to determine how far through the process of examining, verifying, and selecting a valid candidate pair is prior to successfully connecting the two peers for WebRTC communications.

description.html: The connectionstatechange event is sent to the onconnectionstatechange event handler on an RTCPeerConnection object after a new track has been added to an RTCRtpReceiver which is part of the connection. The new connection state can be found in connectionState, and is one of the string values: new, connecting, connected, disconnected, failed, or closed.

The connectionstatechange event is sent to the onconnectionstatechange event handler on an RTCPeerConnection object after a new track has been added to an RTCRtpReceiver which is part of the connection.
  The new connection state can be found in connectionState,
  and is one of the string values:
  new, connecting, connected, disconnected,
  failed, or closed.

description.html: A datachannel event is sent to an RTCPeerConnection instance when an RTCDataChannel has been added to the connection, as a result of the remote peer calling RTCPeerConnection.createDataChannel().
description.text: A datachannel event is sent to an RTCPeerConnection instance when an RTCDataChannel has been added to the connection, as a result of the remote peer calling RTCPeerConnection.createDataChannel().

description.html: The WebRTC API event icecandidateerror is sent to an RTCPeerConnection if an error occurs while performing ICE negotiations through a STUN or TURN server. The event object is of type RTCPeerConnectionIceErrorEvent, and contains information describing the error in some amount of detail.
description.text: The WebRTC API event icecandidateerror is sent to an RTCPeerConnection if an error occurs while performing ICE negotiations through a STUN or TURN server. description.html: An icecandidate event is sent to an RTCPeerConnection when an RTCIceCandidate has been identified and added to the local peer by a call to RTCPeerConnection.setLocalDescription(). The event handler should transmit the candidate to the remote peer over the signaling channel so the remote peer can add it to its set of remote candidates.

The event handler should transmit the candidate to the remote peer over the signaling channel so the remote peer can add it to its set of remote candidates.

description.html: An iceconnectionstatechange event is sent to an RTCPeerConnection object each time the ICE connection state changes during the negotiation process. The new ICE connection state is available in the object's iceConnectionState property.
description.text:
An iceconnectionstatechange event is sent to an RTCPeerConnection object each time the ICE connection state changes during the negotiation process.

description.html: The icegatheringstatechange event is sent to the onicegatheringstatechange event handler on an RTCPeerConnection when the state of the ICE candidate gathering process changes. This signifies that the value of the connection's iceGatheringState property has changed.
description.text:
The icegatheringstatechange event is sent to the onicegatheringstatechange event handler on an RTCPeerConnection when the state of the ICE candidate gathering process changes.
  This signifies that the value of the connection's iceGatheringState property has changed.

description.html: A negotiationneeded event is sent to the RTCPeerConnection when negotiation of the connection through the signaling channel is required. This occurs both during the initial setup of the connection as well as any time a change to the communication environment requires reconfiguring the connection.

description.html: The gamepaddisconnected event is fired when the browser detects that a gamepad has been disconnected.

description.html: The hashchange event is fired when the fragment identifier of the URL has changed (the part of the URL beginning with and following the # symbol).
description.text: The hashchange event is fired when the fragment identifier of the URL has changed (the part of the URL beginning with and following the # symbol).

description.html: The languagechange event is fired at the global scope object when the user's preferred language changes.
description.text: The languagechange event is fired at the global scope object when the user's preferred language changes.

description.html: The offline event of the Window interface is fired when the browser has lost access to the network and the value of Navigator.onLine switches to false.
description.text: The offline event of the Window interface is fired when the browser has lost access to the network and the value of Navigator.onLine switches to false.

description.html: The online event of the Window interface is fired when the browser has gained access to the network and the value of Navigator.onLine switches to true.
description.text: The online event of the Window interface is fired when the browser has gained access to the network and the value of Navigator.onLine switches to true.

description.html: The pagehide event is sent to a Window when the browser hides the current page in the process of presenting a different page from the session's history.
description.text: The pagehide event is sent to a Window when the browser hides the current page in the process of presenting a different page from the session's history.

description.html: The pageshow event is sent to a Window when the browser displays the window's document due to navigation.
description.text: The pageshow event is sent to a Window when the browser displays the window's document due to navigation.

description.html: The popstate event of the Window interface is fired when the active history entry changes while the user navigates the session history. It changes the current history entry to that of the last page the user visited or, if history.pushState() has been used to add a history entry to the history stack, that history entry is used instead.
description.text: The popstate event of the Window interface is fired when the active history entry changes while the user navigates the session history. It changes the current history entry to that of the last page the user visited or, if history.pushState() has been used to add a history entry to the history stack, that history entry is used instead.

description.html: The rejectionhandled event is sent to the script's global scope (usually window but also Worker) whenever a rejected JavaScript Promise is handled late, i.e. when a handler is attached to the promise after its rejection had caused an unhandledrejection event.
description.text: The rejectionhandled event is sent to the script's global scope (usually window but also Worker) whenever a rejected JavaScript Promise is handled late, i.e. when a handler is attached to the promise after its rejection had caused an unhandledrejection event.

description.html: The storage event of the Window interface fires when a storage area (localStorage) has been modified in the context of another document.
description.text: The storage event of the Window interface fires when a storage area (localStorage) has been modified in the context of another document.

description.html: The unhandledrejection event is sent to the global scope of a script when a JavaScript Promise that has no rejection handler is rejected; typically, this is the window, but may also be a Worker.
description.text: The unhandledrejection event is sent to the global scope of a script when a JavaScript Promise that has no rejection handler is rejected; typically, this is the window, but may also be a Worker.
